self.title: CDISC Clinical Classification Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version Test Code Terminology

definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version test code.
name: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version Clinical Classification Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC Clinical Classification Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version Test Code Terminology
synonyms: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version Clinical Classification Test Code

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Recurrent, involuntary, and intrusive distressing memories of the traumatic event(s).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Recurrent Distressing Memories

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Recurrent and intrusive distressing recollections of the event, including images, thoughts, or perceptions: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Recurrent Distressing Recollections Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Recurrent and intrusive distressing recollections of the event, including images, thoughts, or perceptions: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Recurrent Distressing Recollections Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Recurrent distressing dreams in which the content and/or affect of the dream is related to the event(s).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Recurrent Distressing Dream

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Recurrent distressing dreams of the event: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Recurrent Distressing Dream Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Recurrent distressing dreams of the event: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Recurrent Distressing Dream Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Dissociative reactions (e.g., flashbacks) in which the individual feels or acts as if the traumatic event(s) were recurring. (Such reactions may occur on a continuum, with the most extreme expression being a complete loss of awareness of present surroundings.)
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Feel as if Event Recurring

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Acting or feeling as if the traumatic event were recurring (includes a sense of reliving the experience, illusions, hallucinations, and dissociative flashback episodes, including those that occur on awakening or when intoxicated.): Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Feel as if Event Recurring Frequency
synonyms: CAP01-Feel as if Event Recurring Freq

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Acting or feeling as if the traumatic event were recurring (includes a sense of reliving the experience, illusions, hallucinations, and dissociative flashback episodes, including those that occur on awakening or when intoxicated.): Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Feel as if Event Recurring Intensity
synonyms: CAP01-Feel as if Event Recurring Intens

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Intense or prolonged psychological distress at exposure to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event(s).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Psychological Distress at Exposure

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Intense psychological distress at exposure to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Psychological Distress at Exposure Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Intense psychological distress at exposure to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Psychological Distress at Exposure Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Marked physiological reactions to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event(s).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Physiological Reactions to Cues

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Physiological reactivity on exposure to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Physiological Reactions to Cues Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Physiological reactivity on exposure to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Physiological Reactions to Cues Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Avoidance or efforts to avoid distressing memories, thoughts, or feelings about or closely associated with the traumatic event(s).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Avoid Thoughts Associated

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Efforts to avoid thoughts, feelings, or conversations associated with the trauma: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Avoid Thoughts Associated Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Efforts to avoid thoughts, feelings, or conversations associated with the trauma: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Avoid Thoughts Associated Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Avoidance or efforts to avoid external reminders (people, places, conversations, activities, objects, situations) that arouse distressing memories, thoughts, or feelings about or closely associated with the traumatic event(s).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Efforts to Avoid External Reminder

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Efforts to avoid activities, places, or people that arouse recollections of the trauma: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Efforts to Avoid Activities Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Efforts to avoid activities, places, or people that arouse recollections of the trauma: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Efforts to Avoid Activities Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Inability to remember an important aspect of the traumatic event(s) (typically dissociative amnesia that is not due to head injury, alcohol, or drugs).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Inability to Remember Aspect

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Inability to recall an important aspect of the trauma: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Inability to Recall Aspect Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Inability to recall an important aspect of the trauma: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Inability to Recall Aspect Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Persistent and exaggerated negative beliefs or expectations about oneself, others, or the world (e.g., "I am bad," "No one can be trusted," "The world is completely dangerous"). (Alternatively, this might be expressed as, e.g., "I've lost my soul forever," "My whole nervous system is permanently ruined.").
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Persistent Exaggerated Negative Beliefs

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Persistent, distorted blame of self or others about the cause or consequences of the traumatic event(s).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Persistent Blame of Self or Others

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Persistent negative emotional state (e.g., fear, horror, anger, guilt, or shame).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Persistent Negative Emotional State

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Markedly diminished interest or participation in significant activities.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Diminished Interest Activities

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Markedly diminished interest or participation in significant activities: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Diminished Interest Activities Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Markedly diminished interest or participation in significant activities: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Diminished Interest Activities Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Feelings of detachment or estrangement from others.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Feeling of Detachment

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Feeling of detachment or estrangement from others: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Feeling of Detachment Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Feeling of detachment or estrangement from others: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Feeling of Detachment Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Persistent inability to experience positive emotions (e.g., inability to experience happiness, satisfaction, or loving feelings).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Inability Positive Emotions

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Restricted range of affect (e.g., unable to have loving feelings): Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Restricted Range of Affect Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Restricted range of affect (e.g., unable to have loving feelings): Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Restricted Range of Affect Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Sense of a foreshortened future (e.g., does not expect to have a career, marriage, children, or a normal life span): Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Sense Foreshortened Future Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Sense of a foreshortened future (e.g., does not expect to have a career, marriage, children, or a normal life span): Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Sense Foreshortened Future Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Irritable behavior and angry outbursts (with little or no provocation) typically expressed as verbal or physical aggression toward people or objects.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Irritable Behavior Angry Outbursts

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Irritability or outbursts of anger: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Irritability or Outbursts Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Irritability or outbursts of anger: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Irritability or Outbursts Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Reckless or self-destructive behavior.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Reckless or Self-destructive

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Hypervigilance.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Hypervigilance

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Hypervigilance: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Hypervigilance Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Hypervigilance: Intensity.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Hypervigilance Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Exaggerated startle response.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Exaggerated Response

terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Exaggerated Response Intensity

terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Difficulty Concentrating Intensity

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Sleep disturbance (e.g., difficulty falling or staying asleep or restless sleep).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Sleep Disturbance

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Difficulty falling or staying asleep: Frequency.
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Difficulty Falling Asleep Frequency

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM IV Score: Difficulty falling or staying asleep: Intensity.

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Depersonalization: Persistent or recurrent experiences of feeling detached from, and as if one were an outside observer of, one's mental processes or body (e.g., feeling as though one were in a dream; feeling a sense of unreality of self or body or of time moving slowly).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Depersonalization

terms.definition: Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (Current) DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - DSM-5 Scoring: Derealization: Persistent or recurrent experiences of unreality of surroundings (e.g., the world around the individual is experienced as unreal, dreamlike, distant, or distorted).
terms.preferredTerm: CAPS DSM-5 With DSM IV Scoring 2016 Version - Derealization
